Detailed Description

Class for doing an adjustment based on the median intensity of probes with similar GC content.

Definition at line 166 of file GcCorrection.h.

void GcCorrection::learnParameters ( const std::vector< float > &  data,
int  binCount,
std::vector< vector< float > > &  chipBins,
std::vector< char > &  probeGcVec,
bool  warnings 
) [static]

Caluculates medians for different levels (bins) of GC count between 0 and binCount in size and appends to the chipBins.

The probes vector contains a list of probes that are thought to be representative of background at different GC counts. The probeGcVec contains the GC count for all probes on the array.

Parameters:
data - One microarray's worth of data.
binCount - Number of bins we are calculating GC content for.
chipBins - Matrix of chip by gc count containing the median intensity for a collection of gc background probes. Ordering is chipBins[chip][gcCount] and parameters from latest chip in data vector will be appended as last row.
probes - Probes to use for estimating background for particular GC bings.
probeGcVec - GC count of every probe on microarray indexed by id.
warnings - Print warnings if a particular bin is empty? For example: print a warning if there are no probes in the GC count zero bin.
